ygData.subject: Re: FYI from the EQVaults website
ygData.msgSnippet: WOW...you are the shiznit. Can I get an AMEN? Jynxx ... From:  To:  Sent: Wednesday, June 16, 1999 9:25 PM Subject: Re:
ygData.messageBody:
WOW...you are the shiznit. Can I get an AMEN?

Jynxx


----- Original Message -----
From: <Savej@...>
To: <warriors_eq@onelist.com>
Sent: Wednesday, June 16, 1999 9:25 PM
Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] FYI from the EQVaults website


> From: Savej@...
>
> << I picked a warrior so I wouldn't have to think to much... I am just a
poor
> barbarian princess that lost her combine longsword (long story, don't
ask!)>>
>
> No offense, but I think that's the problem. The developers seem to have
felt
> that everyone who plays a warrior is a beginner or someone who doesn't
want
> to be forced to ever make a decision or use player skill more than
measuring
> what to attack, when to attack and when and how to try to run and hide
(all
> of which requires patience and common sense more than anything else; two
> qualities I don't necessarily associate with my idea of a fantastic
medieval
> warrior who wants to kill gnolls, minotaurs, mammoths and dragons but
> nevermind that).
>
> I think we should be given far more to work with. Really, how many hours
(or
> minutes) did it take everyone to master the EQ "melee system"? Given
> hundreds of hours to practice, I really don't think that there's too many
> levels of complexity out there which all of us couldn't or wouldn't be
able
> to readily master without having to think too much and assuming we weren't
> hit with all of our choices at 1st level (which could be intimidating). I
> like playing a warrior in RPGs but not because it's the simplest or
easiest
> class, although it too-often is. I can't stand EQ warriors primarily
because
> whether or not they can talk the talk, they can't walk the walk, but
> additionally because there's no special player skill involved when playing
> one; they have no flexibility in fights and few options other than sit
there
> and die or not (while swinging for 1/4th - 1/10th the damage of some other
> classes). That's just not my definition of "warrior."
>
> BTW, RPing a simpleton or a crude, ignorant savage is another matter
entirely
> which should have nothing to do with game mechanics or the combat style
> requirements of a high ranking swordsman.
>
> ------------------------------------------------------------------------
> Got an opinion?
> http://www.onelist.com
> Make it count! Sign up for the ONElist Weekly Survey now.
> ------------------------------------------------------------------------
> For the Honor and Glory of the Warlord, Rallos Zek!
